name: places/ChIJiZFuviBawokR5P02BA4l1xg
formattedAddress: 80 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 80 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: Lafayette's major drawbacks are its distance from campus and its crumbling infrastructure.  Be prepared to send lots of work requests.  The rooms are pretty good, an adequate amount of space for two people in each room, and the two bathrooms is a big plus.  Another downside is that you'll probably be cooking your own food, but the kitchen is too cramped for more than one person to cook at a time.  Some people complain that the neighborhood is "dangerous" but almost all the time when they say that what they mean is "I hate homeless people" so don't worry.  Overall it's not a bad place to live but also not that great either.

originalText.text:
Fine for summer housing. Reasonably priced for the location and convenience. Kind of decrepit but no major issues. Walls were already very damaged upon moving in. Has air-conditioning and a kitchen. My room (a double) had its own bathroom, while my three other suitemates shared a hallway bathroom.

I did not encounter any bugs, but I was only there for 10 weeks. We had a weird clothing theft problem during the summer, so they locked the laundry rooms on floors 14-17.

originalText.text: This NYU dorm has laundry machines and several rooms in the lobby to kick back. The maintenance team works hard to keep the building good. All complaints taken care of just by submitting a work order.

text.text: This NYU dorm has laundry machines and several rooms in the lobby to kick back. The maintenance team works hard to keep the building good. All complaints taken care of just by submitting a work order.

originalText.text: Triple room had two bathrooms, a kitchen living room combo and two bedrooms for four people. The high ceilings and hardwood floors made the unit seem warm and spacious.  There was lots of light too.  All the units in the building are different. It's a safe neighborhood surrounded by courthouses so there's police around all the time. There's a little sandwich shop right next door and the food was good and reasonably priced. Of course Lafayette is in Chinatown so getting food is not a problem.  This dorm was on the lower end of the NYU price list. Our favorite dorm was on 2nd Street. Much smaller and much more convenient to Tisch.

originalText.text: Stayed here for a summer internship, the people themselves were fine but the dorms were horrendous. Dirty, peeling walls, an a/c unit hooked to a wall switch that was either all on or all off (choose at night between being freezing or sweltering when you wake up). I spent extra for a private room for privacy/sleep. My "private" room was a walled off section of what used to be living room, with 5+ foot gaps between two of the walls and the ceiling so I was awakened by the light and noise every time my suitemates came home at 3am. If you're looking for summer or student housing try to sublet somewhere cheap instead.
